Publications

Search publications on SPIRES, ADS, or astro-ph

The following list of publications will almost certainly be out of date, but captures some of the topics that I've chosen to work on:

"Stellar black holes at the dawn of the universe"
I.F. Mirabel, M. Dijkstra, P. Laurent, A. Loeb, J.R. Pritchard,
A and A, in press
arXiv/1102.1891 (2011) pdf | arxiv
(this received mention in a Nature News and Views article by Zoltan Haiman)

"Hydrogen was not ionized abruptly"
Pritchard, J. and Loeb, A.
Nature news and views 468, 772 (2010). article
(This was an invited article about work on the EDGES experiment by Bowman and Rogers published in Nature: article)

"Constraining massive neutrinos using cosmological 21 cm observations"
Jonathan R. Pritchard and Elena Pierpaoli,
Phys. Rev. D, submitted
arXiv/0805.1920 (2008) pdf | arxiv

"Evolution of the 21 cm signal throughout cosmic history"
Jonathan R. Pritchard and Abraham Loeb,
Phys. Rev. D, submitted
arXiv/0802.2102 (2008) pdf | arxiv

"Cosmic reionization and the 21 cm signal: simulations and analytical models"
Mario G. Santos, Alexandre Amblard, Jonathan Pritchard, Hy Trac, Renyue Cen, and Asanthe Cooray,
Ap. J., submitted
arXiv/0708.2424 (2007) pdf | arxiv

"21 cm fluctuations from inhomogeneous X-ray heating before reionization"
Jonathan R. Pritchard and Steven R. Furlanetto,
Mon.Not.Roy.Astron.Soc. 376, 1680 (2007).
astro-ph/0607234 (2006) pdf | arxiv

"The scattering of Lyman-series photons in the IGM"
Steven R. Furlanetto and Jonathan R. Pritchard
Mon.Not.Roy.Astron.Soc. 372, 1093 (2006).
astro-ph/0605680 (2006) pdf | arxiv

"Galaxy surveys, inhomogeneous reionization, and dark energy"
Jonathan R. Pritchard, Steven R. Furlanetto, and Marc Kamionkowski
Mon.Not.Roy.Astron.Soc. 374, 159 (2007).
astro-ph/0604358 (2006) pdf | arxiv

"Descending from on high: Lyman series cascades and spin-kinetic temperature coupling in the 21 cm line,"
Jonathan R. Pritchard and Steven R. Furlanetto,
Mon.Not.Roy.Astron.Soc. 367, 1057 (2006).
astro-ph/0508381 (2005) pdf | arxiv

"Cosmic Microwave Background Fluctuations from Gravitational Waves: An Analytic Approach"
Jonathan R. Pritchard, and Marc Kamionkowski,
Annals of Physics, 318, 2 (2005).
astro-ph/0412581 (2004) pdf | arxiv

"Bound states and decay times of fermions in a Schwarzschild black hole background,"
Anthony Lasenby, Chris Doran, Jonathan Pritchard, and Alejandro Caceres,
Phys. Rev. D 72, 105014 (2005).
gr-qc/0209090 (2002) pdf | arxiv

True science teaches, above all,
to doubt and be ignorant.
--Miguel de Unamuno
